graphics package¶

Module contents¶

class graphics.Graphics[source]¶

Bases: object

Graphics contains a few very common graphics and UI components used in many places.

classmethod drawButton(destSurf, pos, size, colors, buttonContent, buttonContentSize, buttonFunction=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a button to the screen

Parameters:
  • destSurf – The Surface to draw the button onto.
  • pos ((int, int)) – The positon of the top-left corner of the button
  • size ((int, int)) – The width and height respectively of the button
  • colors ((pygame.Color, pygame.Color)) – A tuple containing two colors. The first is the unfocused color, and the second is the focused color
  • buttonContent (pygame.Surface or string) – This can be either a surface or a string. Either will be drawn to the center of the button
  • buttonContentSize – If the button content is a string, this will be the size of font used to render the text. If the content is a surface, this is the ammount of the button the surface will occupy, from 0 to 1
  • buttonFunction (types.FunctionType) – This is the function that will be executed when the button is clicked on.
classmethod drawStars(screen, pos)[source]¶

Draws a randomly generated background of stars to the provided surface. Also creates a paralax effect for a moving target

Parameters:
  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The pygame.Surface to draw to.
  • pos ((float, float)) – The position of the rocket, used to offset the stars and create a parallax effect.
classmethod drawText(position, content, textFont, color=(0, 0, 0), surface=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a string to the screen

Parameters:
  • position ((int, int)) – The XY position of the top-left corner of the text
  • content (string) – The string the be drawn
  • textFont (pygame.font.Font) – The font to use to render the text.
  • color (pygame.Color) – The rgb color of the text
  • surface (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw to
classmethod drawTextCenter(position, content, textFont, color=(0, 0, 0), surface=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a string to the screen

Parameters:
  • position ((int, int)) – The XY position of the center of the text
  • content (str) – The string the be drawn
  • textFont (pygame.font.Font) – The font to use to render the text.
  • color (pygame.Color) – The rgb color of the text
  • surface (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw to
_buttonIsClicked = False¶

A state variable that stores whether a button is currently being pressed. This is used to prevent buttons’ actions from executing on every single frame.

_isBackgroundDrawn = False¶

A state variable that stores whether the star background has been drawn before. Used to initialize the backgroudn on the first call of drawStars()

_stars = []¶

A list of tuples that hold information about stars. The first number is the x position, and the second number is the y position. The final member is an rgb color tuple.

_starsHeight = 0¶

THe height of the stars Surface

_starsWidth = 0¶

The width of the stars Surface

class graphics.Zoom(base_zoom=1, min_zoom=1.52587890625e-05, max_zoom=8)[source]¶

Bases: object

Utility class to manage zooming in and out of the rocket

Parameters:
  • base_zoom (float) – The default level of zoom
  • min_zoom (float) – The minumum magnification
  • max_zoom (float) – The maximum magnification
reset()[source]¶

Resets the zoom level to the base zoom level

zoom_in()[source]¶

Sets the zoom level to twice the current level.

zoom_out()[source]¶

Sets the zoom level to half the current level.

_base_zoom = 1¶

The starting zoom level

_max_zoom = 8¶

The maxumum magnification

_min_zoom = 1.52587890625e-05¶

The minumum magnification

_zoom = 1¶

The current zoom level

zoom¶

Property storing the current value of _zoom, supports setting and getting.

classmethod drawBackground(closestBody, altitude, offset)[source]¶

Draws the planetary atmosphere of the closest body to the rocket based on altitude.

Parameters:
  • closestBody (physics.CelestialBody) – CelestialBody closest to the rocket
  • altitude (float) – Height of the rocket above closestBody

classmethod getOffset(screen, rocket)[source]¶

Calculates the offset between pymunk and pygame coordinates such that the rocket is rendered in the center of the screen.

Parameters:
  • screen (pygame.Surface) – Current display surface
  • rocket (rockets.Rocket) – Rocket to place in the center of the screen
Returns:

Offset to add to pymunk coordinates
Return type:

pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d

Helper function to get size for scaled sprite for drawSprite()

Parameters:vertices ([(float,float)]) – List of component vertices
Returns:Tuple of (minX, maxX, minY, maxY)
Return type:(int, int, int, int)
classmethod inRange(max, coords)[source]¶

Helper function that checks if coordinates are between (0,0) and max.

Parameters:
  • max – Vec2d of maximum coordinates
  • max – Vec2d of coordinates to check
Returns:

True if coords is in range, False otherwise.
Return type:

bool
classmethod intVec2d(v, func=<class 'int'>)[source]¶

Helper function that applies function to each element of v. Default function is int().

Parameters:

  • func (types.FunctionType) – Function to apply to elements of v
Returns:

Vector v after function application
Return type:

pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d

  • vertices ([(float,float)]) – List of component vertices
Returns:

Scaled sprite image

pygame.Surface
classmethod to_pygame(shape, coords, offset)[source]¶

Convert local pymunk shape coordinates to pygame if shape is not None, else convert global pymunk coordinates to pygame.

Parameters:
  • shape (pymunk.Shape) – Shape local coordinates are in reference to
  • coords (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Coordinates to convert
  • offset (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Offset bewteen pymunk and pygame coordinates
Returns:

Coordinates converted to pygame
Return type:

pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d
_maxZoom = 8¶

Maximum zoom level, 8x normal zoom

_minZoom = 1.52587890625e-05¶

Minimum zoom level, (2^-16)x normal zoom

zoom = <graphics.zoom.Zoom object>¶

Zoom object for handling current zoom level

class graphics.HUD[source]¶

Bases: object

HUD holds diagnostic info and prints values to the screen.

Parameters:
  • _font (pygame.Font) – The font used to draw text to the screen
  • _navBallRadius (int) – The radius in pixels of the Hud’s navball
  • _navBallSubRadius (int) – The radius in pixels of the small viewport within the navball
_drawCompassLine(surface, angle, size, color=(255, 255, 255, 255), innerRadius=None, outerRadius=None)[source]¶

Helper function to draw a line along the normal/radius of a circle

_updateNavBall(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a navball, containing directional information to a pygame Surface.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket who’s information to use.
_updateSASFuel(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the ammound of SAS Fuel that the provided rocket has remaining.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose SAS Fuel should be displayed.
_updateSASIndicator(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface indicating whether or not the provided rocket is currently locked to an angle using SAS.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose SAS state should be checked.
_updateThrottle(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the throttle of the provided rocket.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose throttle to use.
_updateThrusterFuel(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface displaying the ammount of fuel left in each of the thrusters on the provided rocket

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose thruster fuel should be displayed.
_updateTimeScale(scale)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the current ammount time is scaled by.

Parameters:scale (float) – The current ammount time is scaled by.
_updateVelocity(rocket)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the velocity of the provided rocket.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose velocity to use.
_updateZoom(zoom)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the current zoom level.

Parameters:zoom (float) – The current zoom level.
updateHUD(rocket)[source]¶

Draws relevant information from the provided rocket to the screen, like the throttle, velocity, and fuel. Also displays time and zoom information.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose information should be checked.
class graphics.Menu[source]¶

Bases: object

Menu is a class with methods that can draw different menu items or screens to the display.

class State¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The different states that the menu can take

Building = 3¶
Exit = 5¶
Menu = 2¶
Playing = 4¶
Splash = 1¶
classmethod _builderCallback()[source]¶

Callback function to be called when the Rocket Builder button is clicked. This sets the builderPressed bool to be true.

classmethod _demoCallback()[source]¶

Callback function to be called when the “start demo” button is clicked. This sets the demoPressed bool to be true.

classmethod _quitCallback()[source]¶

Callback function to be called when the quit button is clicked. This sets the quitPressed bool to be true.

classmethod _splashCallback()[source]¶

Callback function to be called when the title screen is clicked. This sets the splashScreenPressed bool to be true.

classmethod drawBackground(color_rgb, opacity)[source]¶

Draws the background using the given color and opacity alpha value.

Parameters:
  • color_rgb (pygame.Color) – The color of the background
  • opacity (int) – The alpha value with which to draw the background
classmethod drawMenu(opacity)[source]¶

Draws the menu screen and buttons to pygame’s current display surface.

Parameters:opacity (int) – The alpha value with which to draw the menu background
classmethod drawSplashScreen(opacity)[source]¶

Draws the title screen to pygame’s current display surface.

Parameters:opacity (int) – The alpha value with which to draw the splash screen background
_fullscreen_icon = <Surface(32x32x32 SW)>¶

Icons made by Freepik from Flaticon. Licensed by CC 3.0 BY

_menuButtonColor = ((255, 255, 255, 64), (255, 255, 255, 128))¶

The color to use for the menu buttons

_windowed_icon = <Surface(32x32x32 SW)>¶

Icons made by Freepik from Flaticon. Licensed by CC 3.0 BY

builderPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the Rocket builder button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch htis and take appropriate action on change.

demoPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the “start demo” button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch this and take appropriate action on change

quitPressed = False¶

Becomes true when a the quit button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch this and take appropriate action on change

splashScreenPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the first screen (title screen) has been clicked on. A higher order class can watch this and proceed to the actual menu.

class graphics.Trajectory[source]¶

Bases: object

Drawer for the projected trajectory of the rocket.

classmethod draw(rocket, planetBodies, max_timesteps, dt)[source]¶
Draws the projected path of the rocket until a stopping condition is reached, namely:
  • A point in the projection goes off the current display.
  • A point in the planet intersect a planetary body.
  • The iteration count exceeds max_timesteps.
Parameters:
  • rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket to project
  • planetBodies ([physics.CelestialBody]) – List of all planetary bodies
  • max_timesteps (int) – Maximum iterations before stopping
  • dt (float) – Iteration step size
classmethod eulers(f_prev, dt, dfdt)[source]¶

Uses the forward Euler method to approximate the the value of a function at the next timestep. Specifically, returns \(f_{next} = f_{prev} + \Delta t\cdot\frac{fp}{dt}\), where \(\frac{df}{dt}\) is the derivative of the fuction at the previous timestep.

Parameters:
  • f_prev (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Function value at previous timestep
  • dt (float) – Small change in time (\(\Delta t\)), a smaller value yields a more accurate approximation
  • dfdt (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Value of the derivative \(\frac{df}{dt}\).
Returns:

Projected function value at the next timestep
Return type:

pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d
classmethod hitsPlanet(position, planets)[source]¶

Helper function that provides a stopping condition

Parameters:
  • position ((float,float)) – Position to check
  • planets ([physics.CelestialBody]) – List of planets
Returns:

True if position is inside one of planets, False otherwise
class graphics.Explosion(duration, images, *group)[source]¶

Bases: pygame.sprite.Sprite

Create a new explosion animation

Parameters:
  • duration (int) – number of ticks for which to display the explosion animation
  • images ([pygame.Surface]) – array of animation frames
get_draw()[source]¶

Gets the current animation image if duration is non-zero.

Returns:image or None
Return type:pygame.Surface
update_frame()[source]¶

Updates image to the next frame of the animation, looping around once the final frame is reached.

current_frame = None¶

Current frame step in animation

duration = None¶

number of ticks for animation

image = None¶

Current displayed image

images = None¶

Animation frames passed from images

rect = None¶

rectangle containing the surface of the sprite

size = None¶

size of explosion sprite

graphics.graphics module¶

class graphics.graphics.Graphics[source]¶

Bases: object

Graphics contains a few very common graphics and UI components used in many places.

classmethod drawButton(destSurf, pos, size, colors, buttonContent, buttonContentSize, buttonFunction=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a button to the screen

Parameters:
  • destSurf – The Surface to draw the button onto.
  • pos ((int, int)) – The positon of the top-left corner of the button
  • size ((int, int)) – The width and height respectively of the button
  • colors ((pygame.Color, pygame.Color)) – A tuple containing two colors. The first is the unfocused color, and the second is the focused color
  • buttonContent (pygame.Surface or string) – This can be either a surface or a string. Either will be drawn to the center of the button
  • buttonContentSize – If the button content is a string, this will be the size of font used to render the text. If the content is a surface, this is the ammount of the button the surface will occupy, from 0 to 1
  • buttonFunction (types.FunctionType) – This is the function that will be executed when the button is clicked on.
classmethod drawStars(screen, pos)[source]¶

Draws a randomly generated background of stars to the provided surface. Also creates a paralax effect for a moving target

Parameters:
  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The pygame.Surface to draw to.
  • pos ((float, float)) – The position of the rocket, used to offset the stars and create a parallax effect.
classmethod drawText(position, content, textFont, color=(0, 0, 0), surface=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a string to the screen

Parameters:
  • position ((int, int)) – The XY position of the top-left corner of the text
  • content (string) – The string the be drawn
  • textFont (pygame.font.Font) – The font to use to render the text.
  • color (pygame.Color) – The rgb color of the text
  • surface (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw to
classmethod drawTextCenter(position, content, textFont, color=(0, 0, 0), surface=None)[source]¶

Utility function that draws a string to the screen

Parameters:

  • content (str) – The string the be drawn
  • textFont (pygame.font.Font) – The font to use to render the text.
  • color (pygame.Color) – The rgb color of the text
  • surface (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw to
_buttonIsClicked = False¶

A state variable that stores whether a button is currently being pressed. This is used to prevent buttons’ actions from executing on every single frame.

_isBackgroundDrawn = False¶

A state variable that stores whether the star background has been drawn before. Used to initialize the backgroudn on the first call of drawStars()

_stars = []¶

A list of tuples that hold information about stars. The first number is the x position, and the second number is the y position. The final member is an rgb color tuple.

_starsHeight = 0¶

THe height of the stars Surface

_starsWidth = 0¶

The width of the stars Surface

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose velocity to use.
_updateZoom(zoom)[source]¶

Creates and returns a surface containing the current zoom level.

Parameters:zoom (float) – The current zoom level.
updateHUD(rocket)[source]¶

Draws relevant information from the provided rocket to the screen, like the throttle, velocity, and fuel. Also displays time and zoom information.

Parameters:rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket whose information should be checked.

classmethod _builderCallback()[source]¶

Callback function to be called when the Rocket Builder button is clicked. This sets the builderPressed bool to be true.

Callback function to be called when the “start demo” button is clicked. This sets the demoPressed bool to be true.

builderPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the Rocket builder button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch htis and take appropriate action on change.

demoPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the “start demo” button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch this and take appropriate action on change

quitPressed = False¶

Becomes true when a the quit button has been pressed. A higher order class can watch this and take appropriate action on change

splashScreenPressed = False¶

Becomes true when the first screen (title screen) has been clicked on. A higher order class can watch this and proceed to the actual menu.

graphics.trajectory module¶

class graphics.trajectory.Trajectory[source]¶

Bases: object

Drawer for the projected trajectory of the rocket.

classmethod draw(rocket, planetBodies, max_timesteps, dt)[source]¶
Draws the projected path of the rocket until a stopping condition is reached, namely:
  • A point in the projection goes off the current display.
  • A point in the planet intersect a planetary body.
  • The iteration count exceeds max_timesteps.
Parameters:
  • rocket (rockets.Rocket) – The rocket to project
  • planetBodies ([physics.CelestialBody]) – List of all planetary bodies
  • max_timesteps (int) – Maximum iterations before stopping
  • dt (float) – Iteration step size
classmethod eulers(f_prev, dt, dfdt)[source]¶

Uses the forward Euler method to approximate the the value of a function at the next timestep. Specifically, returns \(f_{next} = f_{prev} + \Delta t\cdot\frac{fp}{dt}\), where \(\frac{df}{dt}\) is the derivative of the fuction at the previous timestep.

Parameters:
  • f_prev (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Function value at previous timestep
  • dt (float) – Small change in time (\(\Delta t\)), a smaller value yields a more accurate approximation
  • dfdt (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d) – Value of the derivative \(\frac{df}{dt}\).
Returns:

Projected function value at the next timestep
Return type:

pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d
classmethod hitsPlanet(position, planets)[source]¶

Helper function that provides a stopping condition

Parameters:
  • position ((float,float)) – Position to check
  • planets ([physics.CelestialBody]) – List of planets
Returns:

True if position is inside one of planets, False otherwise

graphics.zoom module¶

Bases: object

Utility class to manage zooming in and out of the rocket

Parameters:
  • base_zoom (float) – The default level of zoom
  • min_zoom (float) – The minumum magnification
  • max_zoom (float) – The maximum magnification
reset()[source]¶

Resets the zoom level to the base zoom level

zoom_in()[source]¶

Sets the zoom level to twice the current level.

zoom_out()[source]¶

Sets the zoom level to half the current level.

_base_zoom = 1¶

The starting zoom level

_max_zoom = 8¶

The maxumum magnification

_min_zoom = 1.52587890625e-05¶

The minumum magnification

_zoom = 1¶

The current zoom level

zoom¶

Property storing the current value of _zoom, supports setting and getting.
